page.title: 16WORKINGMENS CLUBS,SEAHAM
page.content: MANY PEOPLE USE WORKINGMEN'S CLUBS FOR THEIR EVENING SOCIAL LIVES.THE CLUBS ATTEMPT TO PASS ON THEIR PROFITS EITHER BACK TO THE MEMBERS OR TOWARDS RENOVATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF PREMISES.BECAUSE OF THIS THE CLUBS ARE GENERALLY CHEAPER THAN THE PUBLIC HOUSES.EACH CLUB IS MANAGED BY A COMMITTEE ELECTED BY THE MEMBERS,FROM THE MEMBERSHIP.IT IS THE COMMITTEE'S RESPONSIBILITY TO ORGANISE FINANCE, EMPLOY STAFF AND SUPERVISE ENTERTAINMENTS.MOST CLUBS HAVE A LARGE CONCERT HALL AND STAGE AND SO PROVIDE SUCH ACTS AS SHOWGROUPS,SINGERS OR DISCOS.CLUBS HAVE TEAMS FOR DARTS, DOMINOES,POOL AND SNOOKER.THE TEAMS COMPETE AGAINST EACH OTHER IN LOCAL LEAGUES.CLUBS ALSO ACT AS VENUES FOR THE ANNUAL FLOWER OR VEGETABLE SHOWS. THEY SOMETIMES HIRE THEIR PREMISES FOR WEDDINGS OR OTHER FAMILY FUNCTIONS.
